did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation
did.unittitle:
Thomas Tyler Bouldin Papers,
1834-1850.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Thomas Tyler Bouldin Papers, Manuscript MS 87.3, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Dept. of Collections, 1987.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Thomas Tyler Bouldin was apparently the son of Congressman Thomas T. Bouldin and a grandson of Major Wood Bouldin and Joanna Tyler Bouldin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers of Thomas Tyler Bouldin, Hezahiah Brooks, Sr., and others include bills, accounts, promissory notes, receipts, letters, and some legal documents. The papers concern family matters, clothing, tobacco, Gilliam family history, and a fine for not attending muster. Includes correspondents from Charlottesville, Charlotte County, and elsewhere. These papers were found inside an eighteenth-century spinet owned by Joanna Tyler Bouldin.

did.unittitle: Bill for clothing. Jno. Cochnar to Thomas T. Bouldin, 8 November 1834-20 January 1835.
Account of Hezikiah Brooks with James McGraw, 1 April 1836-18 December 1839.
Bill to Hez[ikiah] Brooks, Sr. for services of the clerk of Halifax Circuit Sup. Co., April 1838.
Promissory note. Hezikiah Brooks, Sr. to McGraw, Barksdale & Co., 3 March 1839.
Account of Mr. Guysee with H. Hall, 5 November 1840-21 December 1840.
Bill to James Hill for not attending the October muster of Captain Milner, 1840.
Fragment of tailoring account of Jno. Patterson, 1840.
Draft of promissory note. John D. Richardson to Elisha E. Hundley and [William?] Bailey, 1 November 1841.
Promissory note. Richard Walne to Addison Irvine, 1 March 1842.
Account of Benjamin Lax, April 1842.
Account of Hezikiah Brooks with McGraw & Co., 24 October 1842.
Fragment. Note on a document filed in Lynchburg, Hustings Court, 31 October 1842.
Receipt to Thomas T. Bouldin from Winslow Robinson, 4 September 1843.
Letter re collection of a debt. J. Read, Charleston, to Thomas T. Bouldin, Charlotv..., 18 November 1844.
Account of Mr. Murphy with Read & Flournay, 1845.
Fragment of bill of Wood Bou[ldin] from [Tho]mas Anderson, May 1846.
Bond account of Thomas T. Bouldin with Clairborne Barksdale, 25 December 1846.
Account of Doctor's visits. Jesse Wilkes with Dr. John P. Brown, 18 August 1847-1 January 1849.
Account of Wood Bouldin with J. Dupuy, 5 January 1849.
Receipt. Mr. Ward (?) Furguson to Mitchell & Tyler, Richmond, 1849.
Letter re Gilliam family history. William E. Gilliam, Cornissville, Marshall County, Mississppi to Thomas T. Bouldin, 21 August 1850.
Bond. William Baldwin to Charles Hutchinson, 26 December 1850.
Tobacco account of Hezikiah Brooks, Jr., n.d.
Letter fragment to Thomas T. Bouldin, n.d.
Order to the sheriff of Lynchburg, n.d.
Letter to George W. Read, Charlotte County, n.d.
Letter re a slave to [Thomas?] Bouldin, n.d.
Promissory note. Armistead Say to McGraw, Barksdale & Co., 27 March, n.y.
Legal document of William H. Barksdale, 25 April n.y.
